resources.string: We recommend you to use headphones in order to this game.
A game by, Blind Faith Games
This application works on portrait mode.

This is a research project that tries to gather insight on how blind people play games on mobile devices and how developers could make games that are not only accessible, but also enjoyable for them. Select an interaction mode depending on if you have visual discapacity or not. To select make a long press to select an option

This is a research project that tries to gather insight on how blind people play games on mobile devices and how developers could make games that are not only accessible, but also enjoyable for them. Select an interaction mode depending on if you have visual discapacity or not. To select make a long press to select an option

In order to get a better game experience, we recommend you to download the "IVONA Text-to-Speech HQ" synthesizer. Blind Faith Games is not associated or have any relation with IVONA project but we think that is the best synthetizer. Would you like to install it?
Main menu Zarodnik, you can navigate through the menu by making simple taps in the different options and just make a long press to select one of the options below

Zaridnik, 2012. 


Zarodnik is part of Blind Faith Games (BFG), a research project about how to deliver eyes-free game experiences that are enjoyable on your Android™ device regardless of your sight capabilities. If you have some time to spare, please help us to improve the game by filling in the feedback form that can be reached from the main menu.


BFG is a project of the e-UCM research group, developed by Gloria Pozuelo and Javier √Ålvarez.
 e-UCM is a research group of the Department of Software Engineering and Artificial Intelligence at the Complutense University of Madrid.


More info at: http://blind-faith-games.e-ucm.es
 Contact us at: android@e-ucm.es 


Music by www.SoundJay.com & www.freesound.org 


Android is a trademark of Google Inc.
It shows text that contains the sinthetizer speech
It adds one more touch to each screen touch event
Allows to use the application without any visual reference in the game and main menu.
Enables a shot when the drag-drop event occurs

Menu settings. By tapping on each element on this menu changes and reads an option. Particular in this menu you can find two profile options\: A and B whose activation enables another options on the menu. Of course, you can continue enabling independently all option on the menu. You will find the next options on this menu\:

Game Started! You begin in the middle bottom of the screen. Remember you have to find a prey and avoid the predators. By making a long tap on the scoreboard which is situated at the top of the screeen you can listen your score.

Key Configuration. By tapping on your left you could listen the action descriptions and by tapping on your right you will change the key related by an action. If you are in blind interaction mode you have to do a long click to be able to change the configuration. You have the next options\:
To repeat the last sinthetizer voice message
Your punctuaction have been incremented to
Your punctuaction have been decremented to
Your number of consecutive shots is zero.

Once upon a time, there was a little monster from an unknown place. It used to be called Zarodnik and it was involved in a trip under the depths of the ocean. While it was travelling it found a lot of varieties of creatures and learnt many survival aspects. One day, our hero reach one of the biggest ocean of the world, Izlude. Izlude was the best ocean that a marine creature can imagine with enough food to live forever, but when Zarodnik arrived, Izlude was been slaughtered by a new race of monsters\: the Strouf. The Obeaune which were the race that used to live in Izlude during the last centuries became slaves of the Strouf or been killed. Now, the Strouf have taken the control of Izlude, the place where our hero has just arrived. Zarodnik is now involved in this adventure where it will try to save as many Obeaunes as it can by saving it in its belly... But our main character has a limited stomach. What will you do to help it?

Once upon a time, there was a little monster from an unknown place. It used to be called Zarodnik and it was involved in a trip under the depths of the ocean. While it was travelling it found a lot of varieties of creatures and learnt many survival aspects. One day, our hero reach one of the biggest ocean of the world, Izlude. Izlude was the best ocean that a marine creature can imagine with enough food to live forever, but when Zarodnik arrived, Izlude was been slaughtered by a new race of monsters\: the Strouf. The Obeaune which were the race that used to live in Izlude during the last centuries became slaves of the Strouf or been killed. Now, the Strouf have taken the control of Izlude, the place where our hero has just arrived. Zarodnik is now involved in this adventure where it will try to save as many Obeaunes as it can by saving it in its belly... But our main character has a limited stomach. What will you do to help it?
The game concludes here. Long touch on the screen to end
Long click to back to the main menu
You have changed the key associated with
That sound represents the capsule that you can find in the screen. Randomly increments/decrements your size.
If you want to leave this information page make a long touch on the screen.
On this screen you will learn the sounds related with the game elements. Remember! At this screen, you can make a double tap on the different positions of the screen to listen different sounds.
That sound represents a Strouf which is the powerful creature that have take over the ocean of Izlude. You must avoid this creatures or you will be killed.

That sound represents an Obeaune, the weakness creature. Only a few have survive. Your task is to find and save as many Obeaunes as you can store in Zarodnik. But caution, if you save a lot of them you will grow more and more and avoid the Stroufs will be harder.
That sound represents an emitter lotam. Rest of an ancient civilitation previous to obeaune. It will help you to know the direction where the obeaune are localizated.
That sound represents a legendary Chainfish. This mysterious creature lives in Izlude and it said that the one who eat it would be able to avoid Strouf\'s attacks temporaly.
That sound represents a Dr. Konstantin that allows you to rescue more Obeaune and decreasing the player size.

To move Zarodnik, you have to drag your finger on the screen and when you release the touch, everything on the screen will be paused until the next touch. Make a double tap to listen the sound emitted by our hero when it\'s moving.

The game objetive is to save as many preys as you can, avoiding the predators that you could listen near you. The more preys save, the better score you get. If you save a prey, you have to go to one of the edges of the screen to move to the next level and continue the game.

To be able to know which creature is around you in the ocean of Izlude, you have to use headphones. If you hear a sound from your left headphone that indicates that the creature is on your left and depending on the sound pitch, low or high it can be above or below your position at the screen. Remember, you indicate it with your finger by making drags.
You can heard the number of rescued Obeaunes by making a long tap on the top on the screen where there is the scoreboard.
Here you can learn the basics to play. On the next screens, in order to listen the sound entities, you have to make a double tap on the screen.

You can navigate through this form menu by making long taps on the buttons next and previous situated below of each option set or text. If you click on a text or a button and its text will be read and, important!! if it\'s a answer button will be selected.
In this case, if you want, you can write in a field your opinion about the application.
From now on, making taps, you can choose between different answers to respond questions.
You can fill this field with your opinion.

This is a research project that tries to gather insight on how blind people play games on mobile devices and how developers could make games that are not only accessible, but also enjoyable for them. To achieve these goals, we would like to know some details about you and how you interact with technologies in general and games in particular. This will help us to interpret your answers to this questionnaire. All the information collected through this questionnaire will be anonymous, untraceable and will be treated confidentially and only used for the purpose of the study. \n
Mark the option that better describes your current visual level
Rate how often you play games in your computer or game console. Where 1 means "Never" and 5 "very often"
Rate how often you play games in your mobile device (phone or tablet). Where 1 means "Never" and 5 "very often"
Please rate how easy/difficult it was to learn to play. Where 1 means "very difficult" and 5 "very easy".
Rate how fun it was to play. Where 1 means "very boring" and 5 "very fun".
Rate how engaging was the game. Where 1 means "not engaging" and 5 "very engaging".
Rate how pleasant or frustrating was the interaction with the game. Where 1 means "very frustrating" and 5 "very pleasant".
Rate how you liked the story and narrative atmosphere (if applicable). Where 1 means "I didn\'t like it at all" and 5 "I liked it very much".
Rate how you liked the accessibility and control settings. Where 1 means "I didn\'t like it at all" and 5 "I liked it very much".
Rate how you liked the feedback provide by the game. Where 1 means "I didn\'t like it at all" and 5 "I liked it very much".
Finally, please provide any comments or suggestions to improve the game. Then tap on "Finish" to send the responses to us, and that\'s all!
Your screen has turned on. May be you have to unlock your device.
This form is showed in landscape.
Long click on the screen to continue.
